did.abstract: Danes Worldwide Archives located in Aalborg, Denmark. Collection of materials, largely in Danish, concerning the immigration of Danes to the United States as reflected in letters home, journals, and family histories; also include letters of Danish pastors concerning the work of the church in Ashland, Gowen, and Manistee, Michigan.

scopecontent.p: This microfilm is a selection of letters written from individuals who had immigrated from Denmark to the United States. The letters selected were from individuals who had settled in Michigan communities, notably Ashland, Gowen, and Manistee. Other materials in the collection include journals and family histories.

did.unittitle: Julius Petersen
Letters, 1887-1921, to his brother Rasmus (both of Chicago)

note.p: (The letters contain explanatory notes by their brother Karl who remained in Denmark and preserved their letters.)

did.unittitle: Letters, 1887-1921, of Julius and Rasmus Petersen to brother Karl in Denmark

note.p: (The letters are written from Chicago, California, Colorado, and discuss the work of Julius as a gold miner and Rasmus as an employee of various Danish-American newspapers. Included is Karl Petersen's family history, his description of letters from America, and his description of Rasmus' visit home in 1896.)
